module.name: construction_geometry
module.keywords: module, construction geometry, tolerance zones, dimensioning
module.purpose:
This part of ISO 10303 specifies the definition of geometric items needed for constructing geometry or for defining geometric dimensional tolerances. It provides a collection of geometry that is used to support the definition of a geometric model. Construction geometry may be used in the definition of tolerance zones and dimensions of features of the model. The construction geometry may represent centres or tangents derived from the shape. In these cases the construction geometry will be the geometry of a derived geometry. Construction geometry refers directly or indirectly, via intermediate construction geometry or derived geometry to a geometric model.
This module completes the definition of basic geometric concepts begun in module Elemental_geometric_shape.

inscope.li: geometry used in the construction of two-dimensional and three-dimensional shape representations;
association of a construction geometry to a geometric model or a construction from which it is derived.

outscope.li: constructive solid geometry primitives and methods;
geometry of dimension greater than three;
geometry for the representation of properties other than shape.
